item.name: ecoulomb
item.desc: Electrostatic contribution to site energies.

item.name: ecoulomb.method
item.desc: Type of screening used. **simple** for a constant dielectric constant, **distdep** for a distance-dependent screening. In the latter case screening length must be specified.

item.name: ecoulomb.epsilon
item.desc: Relative dielectric constant of the semiconductor.

item.name: ecoulomb.screening
item.desc: Screening length used in the distance-dependent screening.

item.name: ehistogram
item.desc: Histogram of site energy differences of neighbor list pairs.

item.name: ehistogram.min
item.desc: Minimum of the energy interval, eV.

item.name: ehistogram.max
item.desc: Maximum of the energy interval, eV.

item.name: ehistogram.nbins
item.desc: Number of bins.

item.name: ehistogram.file
item.desc: Output file.

item.name: ecorrelation
item.desc: Normalized site energy correlation function.

item.name: ecorrelation.min
item.desc: Minimum of the energy interval, eV.

item.name: ecorrelation.max
item.desc: Maximum of the energy interval, eV.

item.name: ecorrelation.nbins
item.desc: Number of bins.

item.name: ecorrelation.file
item.desc: Output file.

item.name: egaussian
item.desc: Modifies the Coulomb contribution to site energies.

item.name: egaussian.method
item.desc: **gaussian** - generates a gaussian distribution of width sigma. If a correlation and a cutoff parameters are provided then a new site energy is computed for every site by averaging energies of the neighboring, up to a cutoff, sites. The new site energies are then uniformly scaled in order to reproduce the initial width (sigma) of the site energy distribution. **shuffle** - randomly shuffles the (existing) site energies in order to remove spatial correlations.

item.name: egaussian.sigma
item.desc: Variance of site energies.

item.name: egaussian.correlation
item.desc: Correlation of site energies.

item.name: izindo
item.desc: Semi-empirical electronic coupling elements for all neighbor list pairs

item.name: izindo.basisset
item.desc: Basis set used to generate monomer orbitals. Default is **ZINDO**. **Shall be moved from the charge unit description to the calculator options**

item.name: ihistogram
item.desc: Histogram of transfer integrals for all pairs from neighbour list.

item.name: ihistogram.min
item.desc: Minimum of the energy interval, eV.

item.name: ihistogram.max
item.desc: Maximum of the energy interval, eV.

item.name: ihistogram.nbins
item.desc: Number of bins.

item.name: ihistogram.file
item.desc: Output file.

item.name: tdump
item.desc: Outputs the coarse-grained and back-mapped (using rigid fragments) trajectories

item.name: tdump.cg
item.desc: Name of the coarse-grained trajectory.

item.name: tdump.qm
item.desc: Name of the atomistic trajectory with back-substituted rigid fragments.

item.name: eoutersphere
item.desc: Outer sphere reorganization energy for all pairs

item.name: eoutersphere.method
item.desc: Type of method used. Can be **constant**(all pairs have the same value **lambdaconst** set in options file), **spheres**(molecules are treated as spheres with radii **R_lambda** given in the segments file and Pekar factor **pekar** set in options file) or **dielectric** (with Pekar factor **pekar** set in options file and partial charges and resulting dielectric fields)

item.name: eoutersphere.lambdaconst
item.desc: Constant value for all pairs used in method **constant**

item.name: eoutersphere.pekar
item.desc: Pekar factor used for methods **spheres** and **dielectric**

item.name: eoutersphere.R_lambda
item.desc: Radius of spherical molecule as used in method **spheres**

item.name: eoutersphere.cutoff
item.desc: Cutoff radius in nm between pair and the exteroir molecule. Can be used in **spheres** and **dielectric**

item.name: rates
item.desc: Computes hopping rates between molecules in the neighborlist

item.name: rates.method
item.desc: Method chosen to compute rates. Can either be **marcus** or **jortner**. The first is the high temperature limit of Marcus theory, the second fallows the derivation by Jortner and Bixon

item.name: rates.nmaxvib
item.desc: If the method of choice is **jortner**, the maximal number of excited vibrations on the molecules has to be specified as an integer for the summation. The default value is 20

item.name: rates.omegavib
item.desc: If the method of choice is **jortner**, the vibration frequency of the quantum mode has to be given in units of eV. The default value is close to the CC bond-stretch at 0.2eV

item.name: polymerrates
item.desc: kick it out ?

item.name: pairdump
item.desc: Dumps the coordinates of pairs of atoms from the neighbor list. Used as input in DFT-based calculations of electronic couplings.

item.name: pairdump.format
item.desc: *xyz* or *pdb* formats.

item.name: pairdump.subfolders
item.desc: If **true** creates the required by ctp_dipro directory structure. Otherwise dumps all neighbor list pairs into the current folder.

item.name: pairdump.molecules
item.desc: If **true** outputs single molecules, otherwise only pairs. **THIS HAS TO BE CHANGED**

item.name: vaverage
item.desc: Average velocity vector and mobility (along the field) of a single charge carrier.

item.name: vaverage.mobility
item.desc: If **TRUE** outputs also charge mobility along the field. In this case the field should be specified in calc_rates.e_field.
